KwsLexicographicArc Arc
Definition: kws-search.cc:28
Fst
void PreDeterminize ( MutableFst< Arc > *  fst,
typename Arc::Label  first_new_sym,
vector< Int > *  symsOut 
)

Definition at line 317 of file pre-determinize-inl.h.

References fst::pre_determinize_helpers::Closure(), fst::pre_determinize_helpers::CopySetToVector(), CreateSuperFinal(), rnnlm::i, fst::pre_determinize_helpers::InsertMember(), KALDI_ERR, KALDI_VLOG, and rnnlm::n.

Referenced by SafeDeterminizeMinimizeWrapper(), SafeDeterminizeWrapper(), TestDeterminize(), TestDeterminizeStarInLog(), TestFactor(), TestMinimize(), TestPreDeterminize(), and TestPush().

319  {
320  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
321  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
322  typedef size_t ArcId; // Our own typedef, not standard OpenFst. Use size_t
323  // for compatibility with argument of ArcIterator::Seek().
324  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
325  assert(first_new_sym > 0);
326  assert(fst != NULL);
327  if (fst->Start() == kNoStateId) return; // for empty FST, nothing to do.
328  assert(symsOut != NULL && symsOut->size() == 0); // we will output the symbols we add into this.
329 
330  { // (D)(i)(a): check is trim (i.e. connected, in OpenFST parlance).
331  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "PreDeterminize: Checking FST properties";
332  uint64 props = fst->Properties(kAccessible|kCoAccessible, true); // true-> computes properties if unknown at time when called.
333  if (props != (kAccessible|kCoAccessible)) { // All states are not both accessible and co-accessible...
334  KALDI_ERR << "PreDeterminize: FST is not trim";
335  }
336  }
337 
338  { // (D)(i)(b): make single final state.
339  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "PreDeterminize: creating single final state\n";
340  CreateSuperFinal(fst);
341  }
342 
343  { // (D)(i)(c): sort arcs on input.
344  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "PreDeterminize: sorting arcs on input\n";
345  ILabelCompare<Arc> icomp;
346  ArcSort(fst, icomp);
347  }
348 
349  StateId n_states = 0, max_state = 0; // Compute n_states, max_state = highest-numbered state.
350  { // compute nStates, maxStates.
351  for (StateIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > iter(*fst); ! iter.Done(); iter.Next()) {
352  StateId state = iter.Value();
353  assert(state>=0);
354  n_states++;
355  if (state > max_state) max_state = state;
356  }
357  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "PreDeterminize: n_states = "<<(n_states)<<", max_state ="<<(max_state);
358  }
359 
360  vector<bool> p_vec(max_state+1, false); // compute this next.
361  { // D(ii): computing the array p. ["problematic states, i.e. states with >1 input transition,
362  // counting being the initial state as an input transition"].
363  vector<bool> seen_vec(max_state+1, false); // rather than counting incoming transitions we just have a bool that says we saw at least one.
364 
365  seen_vec[fst->Start()] = true;
366  for (StateIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > siter(*fst); ! siter.Done(); siter.Next()) {
367  for (ArcIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > aiter(*fst, siter.Value()); ! aiter.Done(); aiter.Next()) {
368  const Arc &arc = aiter.Value();
369  assert(arc.nextstate>=0&&arc.nextstate<max_state+1);
370  if (seen_vec[arc.nextstate])
371  p_vec[arc.nextstate] = true; // now have >1 transition in, so problematic.
372  else
373  seen_vec[arc.nextstate] = true;
374  }
375  }
376  }
377  // D(iii): set up m(a)
378  std::map<pair<StateId, ArcId>, size_t> m_map;
379  // This is the array m, indexed by arcs. It maps to the index of the symbol we add.
380 
381 
382  // WARNING: we should be sure to clean up this memory before exiting. Do not return
383  // or throw an exception from this function, later than this point, without cleaning up!
384  // Note that the vectors are shared between Q and S (they "belong to" S.
385  vector<vector<StateId>* > S(max_state+1, (vector<StateId>*)(void*)0);
386  vector<pair<vector<StateId>*, size_t> > Q;
387 
388  // D(iv): initialize S and Q.
389  {
390  vector<StateId> all_seed_states; // all "problematic" states, plus initial state (if not problematic).
391  if (!p_vec[fst->Start()])
392  all_seed_states.push_back(fst->Start());
393  for (StateId s = 0;s<=max_state; s++)
394  if (p_vec[s]) all_seed_states.push_back(s);
395 
396  for (size_t idx = 0;idx < all_seed_states.size(); idx++) {
397  StateId s = all_seed_states[idx];
398  std::set<StateId> closure_s;
399  closure_s.insert(s); // insert "seed" state.
400  pre_determinize_helpers::Closure(fst, &closure_s, p_vec); // follow epsilons to non-problematic states.
401  // Closure in this case whis will usually not add anything, for typical topologies in speech
402  vector<StateId> closure_s_vec;
403  pre_determinize_helpers::CopySetToVector(closure_s, &closure_s_vec);
404  assert(closure_s_vec.size() != 0);
405  vector<StateId> *ptr = pre_determinize_helpers::InsertMember(closure_s_vec, &S);
406  if (ptr != NULL) { // was inserted.
407  Q.push_back(pair<vector<StateId>*, size_t>(ptr, 0));
408  } else {
409  assert(!"Error: PreDeterminize failed in initialization\n"); // conceptual bug or programming error.
410  exit(1);
411  }
412  }
413  }
414 
415  vector<bool> d_vec(max_state+1, false); // "done vector". Purely for debugging.
416 
417 
418  size_t num_extra_det_states = 0;
419 
420  // (D)(v)
421  while (Q.size() != 0) {
422 
423  // (D)(v)(a)
424  pair<vector<StateId>*, size_t> cur_pair(Q.back());
425  Q.pop_back();
426  const vector<StateId> &A(*cur_pair.first);
427  size_t n =cur_pair.second; // next special symbol to add.
428 
429  // (D)(v)(b)
430  for (size_t idx = 0;idx < A.size(); idx++) {
431  assert(d_vec[A[idx]] == false && "This state has been seen before. Algorithm error.");
432  d_vec[A[idx]] = true;
433  }
434 
435  // From here is (D)(v)(c). We work out S_\eps and S_t (for t\neq eps)
436  // simultaneously at first.
437  map<Label, set<pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> > > arc_hash;
438  // arc_hash is a hash with info of all arcs from states in the set A to
439  // non-problematic states.
440  // It is a map from ilabel to pair(pair(start-state, arc-offset), end-state).
441  // Here, arc-offset reflects the order in which we accessed the arc using the
442  // ArcIterator (zero for the first arc).
443 
444 
445  { // This block sets up arc_hash
446  for (size_t idx = 0;idx < A.size(); idx++) {
447  StateId s = A[idx];
448  assert(s>=0 && s<=max_state);
449  ArcId arc_id = 0;
450  for (ArcIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > aiter(*fst, s); ! aiter.Done(); aiter.Next(), ++arc_id) {
451  const Arc &arc = aiter.Value();
452 
453  pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId>
454  this_pair(pair<StateId, ArcId>(s, arc_id), arc.nextstate);
455  bool inserted = (arc_hash[arc.ilabel].insert(this_pair)).second;
456  assert(inserted); // Otherwise we had a duplicate.
457  }
458  }
459  }
460 
461  // (D)(v)(d)
462  if (arc_hash.count(0) == 1) { // We have epsilon transitions out.
463  set<pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> > &eps_set = arc_hash[0];
464  typedef typename set<pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> >::iterator set_iter_t;
465  for (set_iter_t siter = eps_set.begin(); siter != eps_set.end(); ++siter) {
466  const pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> &this_pr = *siter;
467  if (p_vec[this_pr.second]) { // Eps-transition to problematic state.
468  assert(m_map.count(this_pr.first) == 0);
469  m_map[this_pr.first] = n;
470  n++;
471  }
472  }
473  }
474 
475  // (D)(v)(e)
476  {
477  typedef typename map<Label, set<pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> > >::iterator map_iter_t;
478  typedef typename set<pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> >::iterator set_iter_t2;
479  for (map_iter_t miter = arc_hash.begin(); miter != arc_hash.end(); ++miter) {
480  Label t = miter->first;
481  set<pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> > &S_t = miter->second;
482  if (t != 0) { // For t != epsilon,
483  set<StateId> V_t; // set of destination non-problem states. Will create this set now.
484 
485  // exists_noproblem is true iff |U_t| > 0.
486  size_t k = 0;
487 
488  // First loop "for each transition a in T_t" (i.e. transitions to problematic states)
489  // The if-statement if (|S_t|>1) is pushed inside the loop, as the loop also computes
490  // the set V_t.
491  for (set_iter_t2 siter = S_t.begin(); siter != S_t.end(); ++siter) {
492  const pair<pair<StateId, ArcId>, StateId> &this_pr = *siter;
493  if (p_vec[this_pr.second]) { // only consider problematic states (just set T_t)
494  if (S_t.size() > 1) { // This is where we pushed the if-statement in.
495  assert(m_map.count(this_pr.first) == 0);
496  m_map[this_pr.first] = k;
497  k++;
498  num_extra_det_states++;
499  }
500  } else { // Create the set V_t.
501  V_t.insert(this_pr.second);
502  }
503  }
504  if (V_t.size() != 0) {
505  pre_determinize_helpers::Closure(fst, &V_t, p_vec); // follow epsilons to non-problematic states.
506  vector<StateId> closure_V_t_vec;
507  pre_determinize_helpers::CopySetToVector(V_t, &closure_V_t_vec);
508  vector<StateId> *ptr = pre_determinize_helpers::InsertMember(closure_V_t_vec, &S);
509  if (ptr != NULL) { // was inserted.
510  Q.push_back(pair<vector<StateId>*, size_t>(ptr, k));
511  }
512  }
513  }
514  }
515  }
516  } // end while (Q.size() != 0)
517 
518 
519  { // (D)(vi): Check that for each state in the FST, d(s) = true.
520  for (StateIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > siter(*fst); ! siter.Done(); siter.Next()) {
521  StateId val = siter.Value();
522  assert(d_vec[val] == true);
523  }
524  }
525 
526  { // (D)(vii): compute symbol-table ID's.
527  // sets up symsOut array.
528  int64 n = -1;
529  for (typename map<pair<StateId, ArcId>, size_t>::iterator m_iter = m_map.begin();
530  m_iter != m_map.end();
531  ++m_iter) {
532  n = std::max(n, (int64) m_iter->second); // m_iter->second is of type size_t.
533  }
534  // At this point n is the highest symbol-id (type size_t) of symbols we must add.
535  n++; // This is now the number of symbols we must add.
536  for (size_t i = 0;static_cast<int64>(i)<n;i++) symsOut->push_back(first_new_sym + i);
537  }
538 
539  // (D)(viii): set up hash.
540  map<pair<StateId, size_t>, StateId> h_map;
541 
542  { // D(ix): add extra symbols! This is where the work gets done.
543 
544  // Core part of this is below, search for (*)
545  size_t n_states_added = 0;
546 
547  for (typename map<pair<StateId, ArcId>, size_t>::iterator m_iter = m_map.begin();
548  m_iter != m_map.end();
549  ++m_iter) {
550  pair<StateId, ArcId> pr = m_iter->first;
551  StateId state = pr.first;
552  ArcId arcpos = pr.second;
553  size_t m_a = m_iter->second;
554 
555  MutableArcIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > aiter(fst, state);
556  aiter.Seek(arcpos);
557  Arc arc = aiter.Value();
558 
559  // (*) core part here.
560  if (arc.ilabel == 0)
561  arc.ilabel = (*symsOut)[m_a];
562  else {
563  pair<StateId, size_t> pr(arc.nextstate, m_a);
564  if (!h_map.count(pr)) {
565  n_states_added++;
566  StateId newstate = fst->AddState();
567  assert(newstate>=0);
568  Arc new_arc( (*symsOut)[m_a], (Label)0, Weight::One(), arc.nextstate);
569  fst->AddArc(newstate, new_arc);
570  h_map[pr] = newstate;
571  }
572  arc.nextstate = h_map[pr];
573  }
574  aiter.SetValue(arc);
575  }
576 
577  KALDI_VLOG(2) << "Added " <<(n_states_added)<<" new states and added/changed "<<(m_map.size())<<" arcs";
578 
579  }
580  // Now free up memory.
581  for (size_t i = 0;i < S.size();i++)
582  delete S[i];
583 } // end function PreDeterminize
rnnlm::n

36  // Assumes only final state has non-zero weight.
37  cur_weight = Times(proxy.Final(cur_state), cur_weight);
38  path->push_back(cur_path);

49  arc.nextstate, cur_path, temp_weight);

1124  {
1125  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
1126  if (fst->Final(s) == Weight::Zero()) {
1127  // search for phi transition. We assume there
1128  // is just one-- phi nondeterminism is not allowed
1129  // anyway.
1130  int num_phis = 0;
1131  for (ArcIterator<Fst<Arc> > aiter(*fst, s);
1132  !aiter.Done(); aiter.Next()) {
1133  const Arc &arc = aiter.Value();
1134  if (arc.ilabel == phi_label) {
1135  num_phis++;
1136  if (arc.nextstate == s) continue; // don't expect
1137  // phi loops but ignore them anyway.
1138 
1139  // If this recurses infinitely, it means there
1140  // are loops of phi transitions, which there should
1141  // not be in a normal backoff LM. We could make this
1142  // routine work for this case, but currently there is
1143  // no need.
1144  PropagateFinalInternal(phi_label, arc.nextstate, fst);
1145  if (fst->Final(arc.nextstate) != Weight::Zero())
1146  fst->SetFinal(s, Times(fst->Final(arc.nextstate), arc.weight));
1147  }
1148  KALDI_ASSERT(num_phis <= 1 && "Phi nondeterminism found");
1149  }
1150  }

fst::StdArc::Weight Weight
Definition: lattice-arcgraph.cc:28
void fst::PruneCompactLattice ( Weight  beam,
MutableFst< ArcTpl< CompactLatticeWeightTpl< Weight, Int > > > *  fst 
)
void PruneSpecial ( const Fst< Arc > &  ifst,
VectorFst< Arc > *  ofst,
typename Arc::Weight  beam,
size_t  max_states = 0 
)

The function PruneSpecial is like the standard OpenFst function "prune", except it does not expand the entire "ifst"- this is useful for cases where ifst is an on-demand FST such as a ComposeFst and we don't want to visit it all.

It supports pruning either to a specified beam (if beam is not One()), or to a specified max_states (if max_states is > 0). One of the two must be specified.

Requirements:

  • Costs must be non-negative (equivalently, weights must not be greater than One()).
  • There must be a Compare(a, b) function that compares two weights and returns (-1,0,1) if (a<b, a=b, a>b). We define this in Kaldi, for TropicalWeight, LogWeight (I think), and LatticeWeight... also CompactLatticeWeight, but we doubt that will be used here; better to use PruneCompactLattice().

Definition at line 161 of file prune-special-inl.h.

Referenced by main().

164  {
165  PruneSpecialClass<Arc> c(ifst, ofst, beam, max_states);
166 }
bool PushCompactLatticeStrings ( MutableFst< ArcTpl< CompactLatticeWeightTpl< Weight, IntType > > > *  clat)

This function pushes the transition-ids as far towards the start as they will go.

It can be useful prior to lattice-align-words (for non-linear lattices). We can't use the generic OpenFst "push" function because it uses the sum as the divisor, which is not appropriate in this case (a+b generally won't divide a or b in this semiring). It returns true on success, false if it failed due to TopSort failing, which should never happen, but we handle it gracefully by just leaving the lattice the same. This function used to be called just PushCompactLattice.

Definition at line 209 of file push-lattice.cc.

References CompactLatticePusher< Weight, IntType >::Push().

Referenced by main(), DeterminizeLatticeTask::operator()(), kaldi::TestMinimizeCompactLattice(), and kaldi::TestPushCompactLatticeStrings().

210  {
211  CompactLatticePusher<Weight, IntType> pusher(clat);
212  return pusher.Push();
213 }
template bool fst::PushCompactLatticeStrings< kaldi::LatticeWeight, kaldi::int32 > ( MutableFst< kaldi::CompactLatticeArc > *  clat)
bool PushCompactLatticeWeights ( MutableFst< ArcTpl< CompactLatticeWeightTpl< Weight, IntType > > > *  clat)

This function pushes the weights in the CompactLattice so that all states except possibly the start state, have Weight components (of type LatticeWeight) that "sum to one" in the LatticeWeight (i.e.

interpreting the weights as negated log-probs). It returns true on success, false if it failed due to TopSort failing, which should never happen, but we handle it gracefully by just leaving the lattice the same.

Definition at line 216 of file push-lattice.cc.

References Divide(), KALDI_ASSERT, KALDI_WARN, Plus(), and Times().

Referenced by main(), DeterminizeLatticeTask::operator()(), kaldi::TestMinimizeCompactLattice(), and kaldi::TestPushCompactLatticeWeights().

217  {
218  if (clat->Properties(kTopSorted, true) == 0) {
219  if (!TopSort(clat)) {
220  KALDI_WARN << "Topological sorting of state-level lattice failed "
221  "(probably your lexicon has empty words or your LM has epsilon cycles; this "
222  " is a bad idea.)";
223  return false;
224  }
225  }
226  typedef CompactLatticeWeightTpl<Weight, IntType> CompactWeight;
227  typedef ArcTpl<CompactWeight> CompactArc;
228  typedef typename CompactArc::StateId StateId;
229 
230  StateId num_states = clat->NumStates();
231  if (num_states == 0) {
232  KALDI_WARN << "Pushing weights of empty compact lattice";
233  return true; // this is technically success because an empty
234  // lattice is already pushed.
235  }
236  std::vector<Weight> weight_to_end(num_states); // Note: LatticeWeight
237  // contains two floats.
238  for (StateId s = num_states - 1; s >= 0; s--) {
239  Weight this_weight_to_end = clat->Final(s).Weight();
240  for (ArcIterator<MutableFst<CompactArc> > aiter(*clat, s);
241  !aiter.Done(); aiter.Next()) {
242  const CompactArc &arc = aiter.Value();
243  KALDI_ASSERT(arc.nextstate > s && "Cyclic lattices not allowed.");
244  this_weight_to_end = Plus(this_weight_to_end,
245  Times(aiter.Value().weight.Weight(),
246  weight_to_end[arc.nextstate]));
247  }
248  if (this_weight_to_end == Weight::Zero()) {
249  KALDI_WARN << "Lattice has non-coaccessible states.";
250  }
251  weight_to_end[s] = this_weight_to_end;
252  }
253  weight_to_end[0] = Weight::One(); // We leave the "leftover weight" on
254  // the start state, which won't
255  // necessarily end up summing to one.
256  for (StateId s = 0; s < num_states; s++) {
257  Weight this_weight_to_end = weight_to_end[s];
258  if (this_weight_to_end == Weight::Zero())
259  continue;
260  for (MutableArcIterator<MutableFst<CompactArc> > aiter(clat, s);
261  !aiter.Done(); aiter.Next()) {
262  CompactArc arc = aiter.Value();
263  Weight next_weight_to_end = weight_to_end[arc.nextstate];
264  if (next_weight_to_end != Weight::Zero()) {
265  arc.weight.SetWeight(Times(arc.weight.Weight(),
266  Divide(next_weight_to_end,
267  this_weight_to_end)));
268  aiter.SetValue(arc);
269  }
270  }
271  CompactWeight final_weight = clat->Final(s);
272  if (final_weight != CompactWeight::Zero()) {
273  final_weight.SetWeight(Divide(final_weight.Weight(), this_weight_to_end));
274  clat->SetFinal(s, final_weight);
275  }
276  }
277 
278  return true;
279 }

VectorFst<Arc>* fst::RandFst ( RandFstOptions  opts = RandFstOptions())

Returns a random FST.

Useful for randomized algorithm testing. Only works if weight can be constructed from float.

Definition at line 56 of file rand-fst.h.

References rnnlm::i, rnnlm::j, and kaldi::Rand().

56  {
57  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
58  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
59 
60  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = new VectorFst<Arc>();
61 
62  start:
63 
64  // Create states.
65  vector<StateId> all_states;
66  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)opts.n_states;i++) {
67  StateId this_state = fst->AddState();
68  if (i == 0) fst->SetStart(i);
69  all_states.push_back(this_state);
70  }
71  // Set final states.
72  for (size_t j = 0;j < (size_t)opts.n_final;j++) {
73  StateId id = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % opts.n_states];
74  Weight weight = (Weight)(opts.weight_multiplier*(kaldi::Rand() % 5));
75  fst->SetFinal(id, weight);
76  }
77  // Create arcs.
78  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)opts.n_arcs;i++) {
79  Arc a;
80  StateId start_state;
81  if(!opts.acyclic) { // no restriction on arcs.
82  start_state = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % opts.n_states];
83  a.nextstate = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % opts.n_states];
84  } else {
85  start_state = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % (opts.n_states-1)];
86  a.nextstate = start_state + 1 + (kaldi::Rand() % (opts.n_states-start_state-1));
87  }
88  a.ilabel = kaldi::Rand() % opts.n_syms;
89  a.olabel = kaldi::Rand() % opts.n_syms; // same input+output vocab.
90  a.weight = (Weight) (opts.weight_multiplier*(kaldi::Rand() % 4));
91 
92  fst->AddArc(start_state, a);
93  }
94 
95  // Trim resulting FST.
96  Connect(fst);
97  if (opts.acyclic)
98  assert(fst->Properties(kAcyclic, true) & kAcyclic);
99  if (fst->Start() == kNoStateId && !opts.allow_empty) {
100  goto start;
101  }
102  return fst;
103 }

79  {
80  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
81  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
82  if (binary) {
83  // We don't have access to the filename here, so write [unknown].
84  VectorFst<Arc> *ans =
85  VectorFst<Arc>::Read(is, fst::FstReadOptions(std::string("[unknown]")));
86  if (ans == NULL) {
87  KALDI_ERR << "Error reading FST from stream.";
88  }
89  *fst = *ans; // shallow copy.
90  delete ans;
91  } else {
92  // Consume the \r on Windows, the \n that the text-form FST format starts
93  // with, and any extra spaces that might have got in there somehow.
94  while (std::isspace(is.peek()) && is.peek() != '\n') is.get();
95  if (is.peek() == '\n') is.get(); // consume the newline.
96  else { // saw spaces but no newline.. this is not expected.
97  KALDI_ERR << "Reading FST: unexpected sequence of spaces "
98  << " at file position " << is.tellg();
99  }
100  using std::string;
101  using std::vector;
102  using kaldi::SplitStringToIntegers;
103  using kaldi::ConvertStringToInteger;
104  fst->DeleteStates();
105  string line;
106  size_t nline = 0;
107  string separator = FLAGS_fst_field_separator + "\r\n";
108  while (std::getline(is, line)) {
109  nline++;
110  vector<string> col;
111  // on Windows we'll write in text and read in binary mode.
112  kaldi::SplitStringToVector(line, separator.c_str(), true, &col);
113  if (col.size() == 0) break; // Empty line is a signal to stop, in our
114  // archive format.
115  if (col.size() > 5) {
116  KALDI_ERR << "Bad line in FST: " << line;
117  }
118  StateId s;
119  if (!ConvertStringToInteger(col[0], &s)) {
120  KALDI_ERR << "Bad line in FST: " << line;
121  }
122  while (s >= fst->NumStates())
123  fst->AddState();
124  if (nline == 1) fst->SetStart(s);
125 
126  bool ok = true;
127  Arc arc;
128  Weight w;
129  StateId d = s;
130  switch (col.size()) {
131  case 1:
132  fst->SetFinal(s, Weight::One());
133  break;
134  case 2:
135  if (!StrToWeight(col[1], true, &w)) ok = false;
136  else fst->SetFinal(s, w);
137  break;
138  case 3: // 3 columns not ok for Lattice format; it's not an acceptor.
139  ok = false;
140  break;
141  case 4:
142  ok = ConvertStringToInteger(col[1], &arc.nextstate) &&
143  ConvertStringToInteger(col[2], &arc.ilabel) &&
144  ConvertStringToInteger(col[3], &arc.olabel);
145  if (ok) {
146  d = arc.nextstate;
147  arc.weight = Weight::One();
148  fst->AddArc(s, arc);
149  }
150  break;
151  case 5:
152  ok = ConvertStringToInteger(col[1], &arc.nextstate) &&
153  ConvertStringToInteger(col[2], &arc.ilabel) &&
154  ConvertStringToInteger(col[3], &arc.olabel) &&
155  StrToWeight(col[4], false, &arc.weight);
156  if (ok) {
157  d = arc.nextstate;
158  fst->AddArc(s, arc);
159  }
160  break;
161  default:
162  ok = false;
163  }
164  while (d >= fst->NumStates()) fst->AddState();
165  if (!ok)
166  KALDI_ERR << "Bad line in FST: " << line;
167  }
168  }
169 }

236  }

Definition: lattice-arcgraph.cc:27
kaldi::Arc
KwsLexicographicArc Arc
Definition: kws-search.cc:28
Fst
void RemoveEpsLocal ( MutableFst< Arc > *  fst)

RemoveEpsLocal remove some (but not necessarily all) epsilons in an FST, using an algorithm that is guaranteed to never increase the number of arcs in the FST (and will also never increase the number of states).

The algorithm is not optimal but is reasonably clever. It does not just remove epsilon arcs;it also combines pairs of input-epsilon and output-epsilon arcs into one. The algorithm preserves equivalence and stochasticity in the given semiring. If you want to preserve stochasticity in a different semiring (e.g. log), then use RemoveEpsLocalSpecial, which only words for StdArc but which preserves stochasticity, where possible (*) in the LogArc sense. The reason that we can't just cast to a different semiring is that in that case we would no longer be able to guarantee equivalence in the original semiring (this arises from what happens when we combine identical arcs). (*) by "where possible".. there are situations where we wouldn't be able to preserve stochasticity in the LogArc sense while maintaining equivalence in the StdArc sense, so in these situations we maintain equivalence.

Definition at line 309 of file remove-eps-local-inl.h.

Referenced by TrainingGraphCompiler::CompileGraph(), TrainingGraphCompiler::CompileGraphs(), SimpleDecoder::GetBestPath(), FasterDecoder::GetBestPath(), BiglmFasterDecoder::GetBestPath(), kaldi::GetHmmAsFst(), NBestDecoder::GetNBestLattice(), main(), SafeDeterminizeMinimizeWrapper(), SafeDeterminizeMinimizeWrapperInLog(), and TestRemoveEpsLocal().

309  {
310  RemoveEpsLocalClass<Arc> c(fst); // work gets done in initializer.
311 }
void RemoveEpsLocalSpecial ( MutableFst< StdArc > *  fst)
inline

As RemoveEpsLocal but takes care to preserve stochasticity when cast to LogArc.

1021  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
1022  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
1023  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
1024  NaturalLess<Weight> nl;
1025  StateId non_coacc_state = kNoStateId;
1026  size_t num_arcs_removed = 0, tot_arcs = 0;
1027  for (StateIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > siter(*fst);
1028  !siter.Done();
1029  siter.Next()) {
1030  vector<size_t> arcs_to_delete;
1031  vector<Arc> arcs;
1032  // pair2arclist lets us look up the arcs
1033  std::map<pair<Label, StateId>, vector<size_t> > pair2arclist;
1034  StateId state = siter.Value();
1035  for (ArcIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > aiter(*fst, state);
1036  !aiter.Done();
1037  aiter.Next()) {
1038  size_t pos = arcs.size();
1039  const Arc &arc = aiter.Value();
1040  arcs.push_back(arc);
1041  pair2arclist[std::make_pair(arc.ilabel, arc.nextstate)].push_back(pos);
1042  }
1043  typename std::map<pair<Label, StateId>, vector<size_t> >::iterator
1044  iter = pair2arclist.begin(), end = pair2arclist.end();
1045  for (; iter!= end; ++iter) {
1046  const vector<size_t> &poslist = iter->second;
1047  if (poslist.size() > 1) { // >1 arc with same ilabel, dest-state
1048  size_t best_pos = poslist[0];
1049  Weight best_weight = arcs[best_pos].weight;
1050  for (size_t j = 1; j < poslist.size(); j++) {
1051  size_t pos = poslist[j];
1052  Weight this_weight = arcs[pos].weight;
1053  if (nl(this_weight, best_weight)) { // NaturalLess seems to be somehow
1054  // "backwards".
1055  best_weight = this_weight; // found a better one.
1056  best_pos = pos;
1057  }
1058  }
1059  for (size_t j = 0; j < poslist.size(); j++)
1060  if (poslist[j] != best_pos)
1061  arcs_to_delete.push_back(poslist[j]);
1062  } else {
1063  KALDI_ASSERT(poslist.size() == 1);
1064  size_t pos = poslist[0];
1065  Arc &arc = arcs[pos];
1066  if (arc.ilabel == 0 && arc.nextstate == state)
1067  arcs_to_delete.push_back(pos);
1068  }
1069  }
1070  tot_arcs += arcs.size();
1071  if (arcs_to_delete.size() != 0) {
1072  num_arcs_removed += arcs_to_delete.size();
1073  if (non_coacc_state == kNoStateId)
1074  non_coacc_state = fst->AddState();
1075  MutableArcIterator<MutableFst<Arc> > maiter(fst, state);
1076  for (size_t j = 0; j < arcs_to_delete.size(); j++) {
1077  size_t pos = arcs_to_delete[j];
1078  maiter.Seek(pos);
1079  arcs[pos].nextstate = non_coacc_state;
1080  maiter.SetValue(arcs[pos]);
1081  }
1082  }
1083  }
1084  if (non_coacc_state != kNoStateId)
1085  Connect(fst);
1086  KALDI_VLOG(1) << "removed " << num_arcs_removed << " of " << tot_arcs
1087  << "arcs.";
1088 }

fst::SafeDeterminizeWrapper
void SafeDeterminizeWrapper(MutableFst< Arc > *ifst, MutableFst< Arc > *ofst, float delta)
Does PreDeterminize and DeterminizeStar and then removes the disambiguation symbols.
Definition: fstext-utils-inl.h:415
void SafeDeterminizeWrapper ( MutableFst< Arc > *  ifst,
MutableFst< Arc > *  ofst,
float  delta = kDelta 
)

Does PreDeterminize and DeterminizeStar and then removes the disambiguation symbols.

This is a form of determinization that will never blow up. Note that ifst is non-const and can be considered to be destroyed by this operation. Does not do epsilon removal (RemoveEpsLocal)– this is so it's safe to cast to log and do this, and maintain equivalence in tropical.

Definition at line 415 of file fstext-utils-inl.h.

References DeterminizeStar(), HighestNumberedInputSymbol(), PreDeterminize(), and RemoveSomeInputSymbols().

Referenced by SafeDeterminizeMinimizeWrapperInLog(), SafeDeterminizeWrapperInLog(), and TestSafeDeterminizeWrapper().

416  typename Arc::Label highest_sym = HighestNumberedInputSymbol(*ifst);
417  vector<typename Arc::Label> extra_syms;
418  PreDeterminize(ifst,
419  (typename Arc::Label)(highest_sym+1),
420  &extra_syms);
421  DeterminizeStar(*ifst, ofst, delta);
422  RemoveSomeInputSymbols(extra_syms, ofst); // remove the extra symbols.
423 }

497  delete ifst_log;
498  delete ofst_log;
499 }
fst::SafeDeterminizeWrapper
void SafeDeterminizeWrapper(MutableFst< Arc > *ifst, MutableFst< Arc > *ofst, float delta)
Does PreDeterminize and DeterminizeStar and then removes the disambiguation symbols.
Definition: fstext-utils-inl.h:415
void ScaleLattice ( const vector< vector< ScaleFloat > > &  scale,
MutableFst< ArcTpl< Weight > > *  fst 
)

Scales the pairs of weights in LatticeWeight or CompactLatticeWeight by viewing the pair (a, b) as a 2-vector and pre-multiplying by the 2x2 matrix in "scale".

E.g. typically scale would equal [ 1 0; 0 acwt ] if we want to scale the acoustics by "acwt".

Definition at line 197 of file lattice-utils-inl.h.

References DefaultLatticeScale(), and ScaleTupleWeight().

Referenced by kaldi::CompactLatticeNormalize(), kaldi::DecodeUtterance(), kaldi::DecodeUtteranceLatticeFaster(), kaldi::DecodeUtteranceLatticeSimple(), kaldi::DecodeUtteranceLatticeTracking(), main(), DeterminizeLatticeTask::operator()(), DecodeUtteranceLatticeFasterClass::operator()(), and TestScalePair().

199  {
200  assert(scale.size() == 2 && scale[0].size() == 2 && scale[1].size() == 2);
201  if (scale == DefaultLatticeScale()) // nothing to do.
202  return;
203  typedef ArcTpl<Weight> Arc;
204  typedef MutableFst<Arc> Fst;
205  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
206  StateId num_states = fst->NumStates();
207  for (StateId s = 0; s < num_states; s++) {
208  for (MutableArcIterator<Fst> aiter(fst, s);
209  !aiter.Done();
210  aiter.Next()) {
211  Arc arc = aiter.Value();
212  arc.weight = ScaleTupleWeight(arc.weight, scale);
213  aiter.SetValue(arc);
214  }
215  Weight final_weight = fst->Final(s);
216  if (final_weight != Weight::Zero())
217  fst->SetFinal(s, ScaleTupleWeight(final_weight, scale));
218  }
219 }

253  {

255  typedef PairWeight<BaseType, BaseType> PairType;
256  const BaseType zero = BaseType::Zero();
257  // Without the next special case we'd get NaNs from infinity * 0
258  if (w.Value1() == zero || w.Value2() == zero)
259  return PairType(zero, zero);
260  FloatType f1 = w.Value1().Value(), f2 = w.Value2().Value();

262  BaseType(scale[1][0] * f1 + scale[1][1] * f2));
263 }
CompactLatticeWeightTpl<Weight, IntType> fst::ScaleTupleWeight ( const CompactLatticeWeightTpl< Weight, IntType > &  w,
const vector< vector< ScaleFloatType > > &  scale 
)
inline

Scales the pair (a, b) of floating-point weights inside a CompactLatticeWeight by premultiplying it (viewed as a vector) by a 2x2 matrix "scale".

Assumes there is a ScaleTupleWeight function that applies to "Weight"; this currently only works if Weight equals LatticeWeightTpl<FloatType> for some FloatType.

157  {
158  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;

162  // Generate a random set of phones.
163  size_t num_phones = 1 + kaldi::Rand() % 10;
164  std::set<int32> phones_set;
165  while (phones_set.size() < num_phones) phones_set.insert(1 + kaldi::Rand() % (num_phones + 5)); // don't use 0 [== epsilon]
166  vector<int32> phones;
167  kaldi::CopySetToVector(phones_set, &phones);
168 
169  int N = 1 + kaldi::Rand() % 4; // Context size, in range 1..4.
170  int P = kaldi::Rand() % N; // 1.. N-1.
171  if (verbose) std::cout << "N = "<< N << ", P = "<<P<<'\n';
172 
173  Label subsequential_symbol = 1000;
174  vector<int32> disambig_syms;
175  for (size_t i =0; i < 5; i++) disambig_syms.push_back(500 + i);
176  vector<int32> phone_syms;
177  for (size_t i = 0; i < phones.size();i++) phone_syms.push_back(phones[i]);
178 
179  SymbolTable symtab_out("cfst-output-syms");
180 
181

183  phones, disambig_syms,
184  N, P);
185 
186  bool test_vec = (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0);
187  VectorFst<Arc> *cfst_vec = NULL;
188  if (test_vec) {
189  cfst_vec = new VectorFst<Arc>(cfst); // fully expand it.
190  cfst_vec->SetInputSymbols(cfst.InputSymbols()); // because isymbols get changed
191  // as it gets constructed.
192  }
193 
194  if (verbose) { // Try to print the fst.
195 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
196  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(cfst, cfst.InputSymbols(), cfst.OutputSymbols(), NULL, false, true, "\t");
197 #else

199 #endif
200  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
201  }
202 
203  /* Now create random phone-sequences and compose them with the context FST.
204  */
205 
206  for (size_t p = 0; p < 10; p++) {
207  vector<int32> phone_seq;
208  int num_subseq = N - P - 1; // zero if P == N-1, i.e. P is last element, i.e. left-context only.
209  float tot_cost = 20.0 * kaldi::RandUniform();
210  VectorFst<Arc> *f = GenRandPhoneSeq<Arc>(phone_syms, disambig_syms, subsequential_symbol, num_subseq, tot_cost, &phone_seq);
211  if (verbose) {
212  std::cout << "Sequence FST is:\n";
213  { // Try to print the fst.
214 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
215  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*f, f->InputSymbols(), f->OutputSymbols(), NULL, false, true, "\t");
216 #else

218 #endif
219  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
220  }
221  }

224  VectorFst<Arc> fst_composed_vec;
225  if (use_matcher) ComposeContextFst(cfst, *f, &fst_composed);
226  else Compose(cfst, *f, &fst_composed);

229  if (test_vec) {
230  Compose(*cfst_vec, *f, &fst_composed_vec);
231  assert(RandEquivalent(fst_composed, fst_composed_vec, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
232  // delete cfst_vec;
233  }
234 
235  // Testing WriteILabelInfo and ReadILabelInfo.
236  {
237  bool binary = (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0);
238  WriteILabelInfo(kaldi::Output("tmpf", binary).Stream(),
239  binary, cfst.ILabelInfo());
240 
241  bool binary_in;
242  vector<vector<int32> > ilabel_info;
243  kaldi::Input ki("tmpf", &binary_in);
244  ReadILabelInfo(ki.Stream(),
245  binary_in, &ilabel_info);
246  assert(ilabel_info == cfst.ILabelInfo());
247  }
248 
249 
250  // These lines are important and a bit confusing.
251  // The Compose algorithm actually sets these symbols, but it gets it wrong,
252  // because it creates a copy of the input symbols of cfst *as they existed at the start*.
253  // They get modified during the composition (assuming we didn't already print out the FST)
254  // because
255  fst_composed.SetInputSymbols(cfst.InputSymbols());
256 
257  if (verbose) {
258  std::cout << "Composed FST is:\n";
259  { // Try to print the fst.
260 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
261  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst_composed, fst_composed.InputSymbols(),
262  fst_composed.OutputSymbols(), NULL, false, true, "\t");
263 #else
264  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst_composed, fst_composed.InputSymbols(),
265  fst_composed.OutputSymbols(), NULL, false, true);
266 #endif
267  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
268  }
269  }
270 
271  // now check the composed FST.
272  float tot_cost_check = CheckPhones<Arc>(fst_composed,
273  phone_syms,
274  disambig_syms,
275  phone_seq,
276  cfst.ILabelInfo(),
277  N, P);
278  kaldi::AssertEqual(tot_cost, tot_cost_check);
279 
280  delete f;
281  }
282  if (test_vec) { delete cfst_vec; }
283 
284  unlink("tmpf");
285 }

void fst::TestDeterminize ( )

Definition at line 69 of file determinize-star-test.cc.

References DeleteISymbols(), DeterminizeStar(), rnnlm::i, rnnlm::j, PreDeterminize(), and kaldi::Rand().

69  {
70  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
71  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
72  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
73 
74  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = new VectorFst<Arc>();
75  int n_syms = 2 + kaldi::Rand() % 5, n_states = 3 + kaldi::Rand() % 10, n_arcs = 5 + kaldi::Rand() % 30, n_final = 1 + kaldi::Rand()%3; // Up to 2 unique symbols.
76  cout << "Testing pre-determinize with "<<n_syms<<" symbols, "<<n_states<<" states and "<<n_arcs<<" arcs and "<<n_final<<" final states.\n";
77  SymbolTable *sptr = NULL;
78 
79  vector<Label> all_syms; // including epsilon.
80  // Put symbols in the symbol table from 1..n_syms-1.
81  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_syms;i++)
82  all_syms.push_back(i);
83 
84  // Create states.
85  vector<StateId> all_states;
86  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_states;i++) {
87  StateId this_state = fst->AddState();
88  if (i == 0) fst->SetStart(i);
89  all_states.push_back(this_state);
90  }
91  // Set final states.
92  for (size_t j = 0;j < (size_t)n_final;j++) {
93  StateId id = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
94  Weight weight = (Weight)(0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 5) );
95  printf("calling SetFinal with %d and %f\n", id, weight.Value());
96  fst->SetFinal(id, weight);
97  }
98  // Create arcs.
99  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_arcs;i++) {
100  Arc a;
101  a.nextstate = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
102  a.ilabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms];
103  a.olabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms]; // same input+output vocab.
104  a.weight = (Weight) (0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 2));
105  StateId start_state = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
106  fst->AddArc(start_state, a);
107  }
108 
109  std::cout <<" printing before trimming\n";
110  {
111 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
112  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
113 #else
114  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
115 #endif
116  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
117  }
118  // Trim resulting FST.
119  Connect(fst);
120 
121  std::cout <<" printing after trimming\n";
122  {
123 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
124  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
125 #else
126  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
127 #endif
128  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
129  }
130 
131  VectorFst<Arc> *fst_copy_orig = new VectorFst<Arc>(*fst);
132 
133  vector<Label> extra_syms;
134  if (fst->Start() != kNoStateId) { // "Connect" did not make it empty....
135  PreDeterminize(fst, 1000, &extra_syms);
136  }
137 
138  std::cout <<" printing after predeterminization\n";
139  {
140 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
141  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
142 #else
143  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
144 #endif
145  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
146  }
147 
148 
149  { // Remove epsilon. All default args.
150  bool connect = true;
151  Weight weight_threshold = Weight::Zero();
152  int64 nstate = -1; // Relates to pruning.
153  double delta = kDelta; // I think a small weight value. Relates to some kind of pruning,
154  // I guess. But with no epsilon cycles, probably doensn't matter.
155  RmEpsilon(fst, connect, weight_threshold, nstate, delta);
156  }
157 
158  std::cout <<" printing after epsilon removal\n";
159  {
160 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
161  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
162 #else
163  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
164 #endif
165  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
166  }
167  VectorFst<Arc> ofst_orig;
168  VectorFst<Arc> ofst_star;
169 
170  {
171  printf("Determinizing with baseline\n");
172  DeterminizeOptions<Arc> opts; // Default options.
173  Determinize(*fst, &ofst_orig, opts);
174  }
175 
176  {
177  printf("Determinizing with DeterminizeStar\n");
178  DeterminizeStar(*fst, &ofst_star);
179  }
180 
181  {
182  std::cout <<" printing after determinization [baseline]\n";
183 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
184  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_orig, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
185 #else
186  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_orig, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
187 #endif
188  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
189  assert(ofst_orig.Properties(kIDeterministic, true) == kIDeterministic);
190  }
191 
192  {
193  std::cout <<" printing after determinization [star]\n";
194 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
195  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
196 #else
197  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
198 #endif
199  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
200  assert(ofst_star.Properties(kIDeterministic, true) == kIDeterministic);
201  }
202 
203  assert(RandEquivalent(ofst_orig, ofst_star, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
204 
205  int64 num_removed = DeleteISymbols(&ofst_star, extra_syms);
206  std::cout <<" printing after removing "<<num_removed<<" instances of extra symbols\n";
207  {
208 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
209  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
210 #else
211  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
212 #endif
213  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
214  }
215 
216  std::cout <<" Checking equivalent to original FST.\n";
217  // giving Rand() as a seed stops the random number generator from always being reset to
218  // the same point each time, while maintaining determinism of the test.
219  assert(RandEquivalent(ofst_star, *fst_copy_orig, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
220 
221  delete fst;
222  delete fst_copy_orig;
223 }

void fst::TestDeterminizeGeneral ( )

Definition at line 34 of file determinize-star-test.cc.

References rnnlm::i, and kaldi::Rand().

34  {
35  int max_states = 100; // don't allow more det-states than this.
36  for(int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
37  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = RandFst<Arc>();
38  std::cout << "FST before determinizing is:\n";
39  {
40 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
41  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
42 #else
43  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
44 #endif
45  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
46  }
47  VectorFst<Arc> ofst;
48  try {
49  DeterminizeStar<Fst<Arc> >(*fst, &ofst, kDelta, NULL, max_states);
50  std::cout << "FST after determinizing is:\n";
51  {
52 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
53  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
54 #else
55  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
56 #endif
57  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
58  }
59  assert(RandEquivalent(*fst, ofst, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length, max*/));
60  } catch (...) {
61  std::cout << "Failed to determinize *this FST (probably not determinizable)\n";
62  }
63  delete fst;
64  }
65 }

78 
79  for(int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
80  RandFstOptions opts;
81  opts.n_states = 4;
82  opts.n_arcs = 10;
83  opts.n_final = 2;
84  opts.allow_empty = false;
85  opts.weight_multiplier = 0.5; // impt for the randomly generated weights
86  // to be exactly representable in float,
87  // or this test fails because numerical differences can cause symmetry in
88  // weights to be broken, which causes the wrong path to be chosen as far
89  // as the string part is concerned.
90 
91  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = RandFst<Arc>();
92  std::cout << "FST before lattice-determinizing is:\n";
93  {
94 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
95  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
96 #else
97  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
98 #endif
99  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
100  }
101  VectorFst<Arc> det_fst;
102  try {
103  DeterminizeLatticeOptions lat_opts;
104  lat_opts.max_mem = 100;
105 
106  if (!DeterminizeLattice<TropicalWeight, int32>(*fst, &det_fst, lat_opts, NULL))
107  throw std::runtime_error("could not determinize");
108  std::cout << "FST after lattice-determinizing is:\n";
109  {
110 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
111  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
112 #else
113  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
114 #endif
115  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
116  }
117  assert(det_fst.Properties(kIDeterministic, true) & kIDeterministic);
118  // OK, now determinize it a different way and check equivalence.
119  // [note: it's not normal determinization, it's taking the best path
120  // for any input-symbol sequence....
121  VectorFst<CompactArc> compact_fst, compact_det_fst;
122  ConvertLattice<Weight, Int>(*fst, &compact_fst, false);
123  std::cout << "Compact FST is:\n";
124  {
125 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
126  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
127 #else
128  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
129 #endif
130  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
131  }
132  if (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 1)
133  ConvertLattice<Weight, Int>(det_fst, &compact_det_fst, false);
134  else
135  if (!DeterminizeLattice<TropicalWeight, int32>(*fst, &compact_det_fst, lat_opts, NULL))
136  throw std::runtime_error("could not determinize");
137 
138  std::cout << "Compact version of determinized FST is:\n";
139  {
140 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
141  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
142 #else
143  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
144 #endif
145  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
146  }
147 
148  assert(RandEquivalent(compact_det_fst, compact_fst, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length, max*/));
149  } catch (...) {
150  std::cout << "Failed to lattice-determinize this FST (probably not determinizable)\n";
151  }
152  delete fst;
153  }
154 }

void fst::TestDeterminizeLatticePruned ( )

Definition at line 36 of file determinize-lattice-pruned-test.cc.

References RandFstOptions::acyclic, RandFstOptions::allow_empty, rnnlm::i, KALDI_ASSERT, DeterminizeLatticePrunedOptions::max_arcs, DeterminizeLatticePrunedOptions::max_mem, DeterminizeLatticePrunedOptions::max_states, RandFstOptions::n_arcs, RandFstOptions::n_final, RandFstOptions::n_states, kaldi::PruneLattice(), kaldi::Rand(), and RandFstOptions::weight_multiplier.

36  {
37  typedef kaldi::int32 Int;
38  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
39  typedef ArcTpl<CompactLatticeWeightTpl<Weight, Int> > CompactArc;
40 
41  for(int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
42  RandFstOptions opts;
43  opts.n_states = 4;
44  opts.n_arcs = 10;
45  opts.n_final = 2;
46  opts.allow_empty = false;
47  opts.weight_multiplier = 0.5; // impt for the randomly generated weights
48  opts.acyclic = true;
49  // to be exactly representable in float,
50  // or this test fails because numerical differences can cause symmetry in
51  // weights to be broken, which causes the wrong path to be chosen as far
52  // as the string part is concerned.
53 
54  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = RandPairFst<Arc>(opts);
55 
56  bool sorted = TopSort(fst);
57  KALDI_ASSERT(sorted);
58 
59  ILabelCompare<Arc> ilabel_comp;
60  if (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0)
61  ArcSort(fst, ilabel_comp);
62 
63  std::cout << "FST before lattice-determinizing is:\n";
64  {
65 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
66  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
67 #else
68  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
69 #endif
70  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
71  }
72  VectorFst<Arc> det_fst;
73  try {
74  DeterminizeLatticePrunedOptions lat_opts;
75  lat_opts.max_mem = ((kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0) ? 100 : 1000);
76  lat_opts.max_states = ((kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0) ? -1 : 20);
77  lat_opts.max_arcs = ((kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0) ? -1 : 30);
78  bool ans = DeterminizeLatticePruned<Weight>(*fst, 10.0, &det_fst, lat_opts);
79 
80  std::cout << "FST after lattice-determinizing is:\n";
81  {
82 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
83  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
84 #else
85  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
86 #endif
87  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
88  }
89  KALDI_ASSERT(det_fst.Properties(kIDeterministic, true) & kIDeterministic);
90  // OK, now determinize it a different way and check equivalence.
91  // [note: it's not normal determinization, it's taking the best path
92  // for any input-symbol sequence....
93 
94 
95  VectorFst<Arc> pruned_fst(*fst);
96  if (pruned_fst.NumStates() != 0)
97  kaldi::PruneLattice(10.0, &pruned_fst);
98 
99  VectorFst<CompactArc> compact_pruned_fst, compact_pruned_det_fst;
100  ConvertLattice<Weight, Int>(pruned_fst, &compact_pruned_fst, false);
101  std::cout << "Compact pruned FST is:\n";
102  {
103 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
104  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_pruned_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
105 #else
106  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_pruned_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
107 #endif
108  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
109  }
110  ConvertLattice<Weight, Int>(det_fst, &compact_pruned_det_fst, false);
111 
112  std::cout << "Compact version of determinized FST is:\n";
113  {
114 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
115  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_pruned_det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
116 #else
117  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(compact_pruned_det_fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
118 #endif
119  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
120  }
121 
122  if (ans)
123  KALDI_ASSERT(RandEquivalent(compact_pruned_det_fst, compact_pruned_fst, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length, max*/));
124  } catch (...) {
125  std::cout << "Failed to lattice-determinize this FST (probably not determinizable)\n";
126  }
127  delete fst;
128  }
129 }

fst::RandFstOptions

fst::kStateHasNonEpsilonArcsLeaving
Definition: epsilon-property.h:31
fst::EnsureEpsilonProperty
void EnsureEpsilonProperty(VectorFst< Arc > *fst)
This function modifies the fst (while maintaining equivalence) in such a way that, after the modification, all states of the FST which have epsilon-arcs entering them, have no non-epsilon arcs entering them, and all states which have epsilon-arcs leaving them, have no non-epsilon arcs leaving them.
Definition: epsilon-property-inl.h:49
fst::kStateHasEpsilonArcsEntering
Definition: epsilon-property.h:28
fst::kStateHasNonEpsilonArcsEntering
Definition: epsilon-property.h:29
fst::ComputeStateInfo
void ComputeStateInfo(const VectorFst< Arc > &fst, std::vector< char > *epsilon_info)
This function will set epsilon_info to have size equal to the NumStates() of the FST, containing a logical-or of the enum values kStateHasEpsilonArcsEntering, kStateHasNonEpsilonArcsEntering, kStateHasEpsilonArcsLeaving, and kStateHasNonEpsilonArcsLeaving.

Definition at line 351 of file fstext-utils-test.cc.

351  {
352  for (size_t i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
353  RandFstOptions opts;
354  opts.allow_empty = false;
355  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = RandFst<Arc>();
356  int length = 10 + kaldi::Rand() % 20;
357 
358  VectorFst<Arc> fst_path;
359  if (EqualAlign(*fst, length, kaldi::Rand(), &fst_path)) {
360  std::cout << "EqualAlign succeeded\n";
361  vector<int32> isymbol_seq, osymbol_seq;
362  typename Arc::Weight weight;
363  GetLinearSymbolSequence(fst_path, &isymbol_seq, &osymbol_seq, &weight);
364  assert(isymbol_seq.size() == length);
365  Invert(&fst_path);
366  VectorFst<Arc> fst_composed;
367  Compose(fst_path, *fst, &fst_composed);
368  assert(fst_composed.Start() != kNoStateId); // make sure nonempty.
369  } else {
370  std::cout << "EqualAlign did not generate alignment\n";
371  }
372  delete fst;
373  }
374 }

EqualAlign is similar to RandGen, but it generates a sequence with exactly "length" input symbols...

void fst::TestFactor ( )

Definition at line 31 of file trivial-factor-weight-test.cc.

References DeterminizeStar(), rnnlm::i, rnnlm::j, PreDeterminize(), and kaldi::Rand().

31  {
32  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
33  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
34  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
35 
36  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = new VectorFst<Arc>();
37  int n_syms = 2 + kaldi::Rand() % 5, n_states = 3 + kaldi::Rand() % 10, n_arcs = 5 + kaldi::Rand() % 30, n_final = 1 + kaldi::Rand()%3; // Up to 2 unique symbols.
38  cout << "Testing pre-determinize with "<<n_syms<<" symbols, "<<n_states<<" states and "<<n_arcs<<" arcs and "<<n_final<<" final states.\n";
39  SymbolTable *sptr = NULL;
40 
41  vector<Label> all_syms; // including epsilon.
42  // Put symbols in the symbol table from 1..n_syms-1.
43  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_syms;i++)
44  all_syms.push_back(i);
45 
46  // Create states.
47  vector<StateId> all_states;
48  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_states;i++) {
49  StateId this_state = fst->AddState();
50  if (i == 0) fst->SetStart(i);
51  all_states.push_back(this_state);
52  }
53  // Set final states.
54  for (size_t j = 0;j < (size_t)n_final;j++) {
55  StateId id = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
56  Weight weight = (Weight)(0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 5) );
57  printf("calling SetFinal with %d and %f\n", id, weight.Value());
58  fst->SetFinal(id, weight);
59  }
60  // Create arcs.
61  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_arcs;i++) {
62  Arc a;
63  a.nextstate = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
64  a.ilabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms];
65  a.olabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms]; // same input+output vocab.
66  a.weight = (Weight) (0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 2));
67  StateId start_state = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
68  fst->AddArc(start_state, a);
69  }
70 
71  std::cout <<" printing before trimming\n";
72  {
73 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
74  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
75 #else
76  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
77 #endif
78  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
79  }
80  // Trim resulting FST.
81  Connect(fst);
82 
83  std::cout <<" printing after trimming\n";
84  {
85 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
86  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
87 #else
88  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
89 #endif
90  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
91  }
92 
93  vector<Label> extra_syms;
94  if (fst->Start() != kNoStateId) { // "Connect" did not make it empty....
95  PreDeterminize(fst, 1000, &extra_syms);
96  }
97 
98  std::cout <<" printing after predeterminization\n";
99  {
100 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
101  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
102 #else
103  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
104 #endif
105  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
106  }
107 
108 
109  { // Remove epsilon. All default args.
110  bool connect = true;
111  Weight weight_threshold = Weight::Zero();
112  int64 nstate = -1; // Relates to pruning.
113  double delta = kDelta; // I think a small weight value. Relates to some kind of pruning,
114  // I guess. But with no epsilon cycles, probably doensn't matter.
115  RmEpsilon(fst, connect, weight_threshold, nstate, delta);
116  }
117 
118  std::cout <<" printing after double-epsilon removal\n";
119  {
120 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
121  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
122 #else
123  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
124 #endif
125  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
126  }
127  VectorFst<Arc> ofst_star;
128 
129  {
130  printf("Converting to Gallic semiring");
131  VectorFst<GallicArc<Arc> > gallic_fst;
132  VectorFst<GallicArc<Arc> > gallic_fst_noeps;
133  VectorFst<GallicArc<Arc> > gallic_fst_det;
134 
135 
136  {
137  printf("Determinizing with DeterminizeStar, converting to Gallic\n");
138  DeterminizeStar(*fst, &gallic_fst);
139  }
140 
141  {
142  std::cout <<" printing gallic FST\n";
143 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
144  FstPrinter<GallicArc<Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
145 #else
146  FstPrinter<GallicArc<Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
147 #endif
148  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
149  }
150 
151 
152  // Map(ofst_star, &gallic_fst, ToGallicMapper<Arc, STRING_LEFT>());
153 
154  printf("Converting gallic back to regular\n");
155 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
156  TrivialFactorWeightFst< GallicArc<Arc, GALLIC_LEFT>, GallicFactor<typename Arc::Label,
157  typename Arc::Weight, GALLIC_LEFT> > fwfst(gallic_fst);
158 #else
159  TrivialFactorWeightFst< GallicArc<Arc, STRING_LEFT>, GallicFactor<typename Arc::Label,
160  typename Arc::Weight, STRING_LEFT> > fwfst(gallic_fst);
161 #endif
162  {
163  std::cout <<" printing factor-weight FST\n";
164 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
165  FstPrinter<GallicArc<Arc> > fstprinter(fwfst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
166 #else
167  FstPrinter<GallicArc<Arc> > fstprinter(fwfst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
168 #endif
169  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
170  }
171 
172 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
173  Map(fwfst, &ofst_star, FromGallicMapper<Arc, GALLIC_LEFT>());
174 #else
175  Map(fwfst, &ofst_star, FromGallicMapper<Arc, STRING_LEFT>());
176 #endif
177 
178  {
179  std::cout <<" printing after converting back to regular FST\n";
180 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
181  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
182 #else
183  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
184 #endif
185  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
186  }
187 
188 
189  VectorFst<GallicArc<Arc> > new_gallic_fst;
190 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
191  Map(ofst_star, &new_gallic_fst, ToGallicMapper<Arc, GALLIC_LEFT>());
192 #else
193  Map(ofst_star, &new_gallic_fst, ToGallicMapper<Arc, STRING_LEFT>());
194 #endif
195 
196  assert(RandEquivalent(gallic_fst, new_gallic_fst, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
197 
198  }
199 
200  delete fst;
201 }

References CreateFactorFst(), ExpandInputSequences(), Factor(), rnnlm::i, MapInputSymbols(), rnnlm::n, kaldi::Rand(), and kaldi::RandUniform().

32  {
33  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
34  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
35  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
36 
37  VectorFst<Arc> fst;
38  int n_syms = 2 + kaldi::Rand() % 5, n_arcs = 5 + kaldi::Rand() % 30, n_final = 1 + kaldi::Rand()%10;
39 
40  SymbolTable symtab("my-symbol-table"), *sptr = &symtab;
41 
42  vector<Label> all_syms; // including epsilon.
43  // Put symbols in the symbol table from 1..n_syms-1.
44  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_syms;i++) {
45  std::stringstream ss;
46  if (i == 0) ss << "<eps>";
47  else ss<<i;
48  Label cur_lab = sptr->AddSymbol(ss.str());
49  assert(cur_lab == (Label)i);
50  all_syms.push_back(cur_lab);
51  }
52  assert(all_syms[0] == 0);
53 
54  fst.AddState();
55  int cur_num_states = 1;
56  for (int i = 0; i < n_arcs; i++) {
57  StateId src_state = kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states;
58  StateId dst_state;
59  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.1) dst_state = kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states;
60  else {
61  dst_state = cur_num_states++; fst.AddState();
62  }
63  Arc arc;
64  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.5) arc.ilabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand()%all_syms.size()];
65  else arc.ilabel = 0;
66  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.5) arc.olabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand()%all_syms.size()];
67  else arc.olabel = 0;
68  arc.weight = (Weight) (0 + 0.1*(kaldi::Rand() % 5));
69  arc.nextstate = dst_state;
70  fst.AddArc(src_state, arc);
71  }
72  for (int i = 0; i < n_final; i++) {
73  fst.SetFinal(kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states, (Weight) (0 + 0.1*(kaldi::Rand() % 5)));
74  }
75 
76  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.8) fst.SetStart(0); // usually leads to nicer examples.
77  else fst.SetStart(kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states);
78 
79  std::cout <<" printing before trimming\n";
80  {
81 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
82  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
83 #else
84  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
85 #endif
86  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
87  }
88  // Trim resulting FST.
89  Connect(&fst);
90 
91  std::cout <<" printing after trimming\n";
92  {
93 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
94  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
95 #else
96  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
97 #endif
98  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
99  }
100 
101  if (fst.Start() == kNoStateId) return; // "Connect" made it empty.
102 
103  VectorFst<Arc> fst_pushed;
104  Push<Arc, REWEIGHT_TO_INITIAL>(fst, &fst_pushed, kPushLabels);
105 
106  VectorFst<Arc> fst_factored;
107  vector<vector<typename Arc::Label> > symbols;
108 
109  Factor(fst, &fst_factored, &symbols);
110 
111  // Check no epsilons in "symbols".
112  for (size_t i = 0; i < symbols.size(); i++)
113  assert(symbols[i].size() == 0 || *(std::min(symbols[i].begin(), symbols[i].end())) > 0);
114 
115  VectorFst<Arc> fst_factored_pushed;
116  vector<vector<typename Arc::Label> > symbols_pushed;
117  Factor(fst_pushed, &fst_factored_pushed, &symbols_pushed);
118 
119  std::cout << "Unfactored has "<<fst.NumStates()<<" states, factored has "<<fst_factored.NumStates()<<", and pushed+factored has "<<fst_factored_pushed.NumStates()<<'\n';
120 
121  assert(fst_factored.NumStates() <= fst.NumStates());
122  // assert(fst_factored_pushed.NumStates() <= fst_factored.NumStates()); // pushing should only help. [ no, it doesn't]
123  assert(fst_factored_pushed.NumStates() <= fst_pushed.NumStates());
124 
125  VectorFst<Arc> fst_factored_copy(fst_factored);
126 
127  VectorFst<Arc> fst_factored_unfactored(fst_factored);
128  ExpandInputSequences(symbols, &fst_factored_unfactored);
129 
130  VectorFst<Arc> factor_fst;
131  CreateFactorFst(symbols, &factor_fst);
132  VectorFst<Arc> fst_factored_unfactored2;
133  Compose(factor_fst, fst_factored, &fst_factored_unfactored2);
134 
135  ExpandInputSequences(symbols_pushed, &fst_factored_pushed);
136 
137  assert(RandEquivalent(fst, fst_factored_unfactored, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
138 
139  assert(RandEquivalent(fst, fst_factored_unfactored2, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
140 
141  assert(RandEquivalent(fst, fst_factored_pushed, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
142 
143  { // Have tested for equivalence; now do another test: that FactorFst actually finds all
144  // the factors. Do this by inserting factors using ExpandInputSequences and making sure it gets
145  // rid of them all.
146  Label max_label = *(std::max_element(all_syms.begin(), all_syms.end()));
147  vector<vector<Label> > new_labels(max_label+1);
148  for (Label l = 1; l < static_cast<Label>(new_labels.size()); l++) {
149  int n = kaldi::Rand() % 5;
150  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) new_labels[l].push_back(kaldi::Rand() % 100);
151  }
152  VectorFst<Arc> fst_expanded(fst);
153  ExpandInputSequences(new_labels, &fst_expanded);
154 
155  vector<vector<Label> > factors;
156  VectorFst<Arc> fst_reduced;
157  Factor(fst_expanded, &fst_reduced, &factors);
158  assert(fst_reduced.NumStates() <= fst.NumStates()); // Checking that it found all the factors.
159  }
160 
161  { // This block test MapInputSymbols [but relies on the correctness of Factor
162  // and ExpandInputSequences to do so].
163 
164  std::map<Label, Label> symbols_reverse_map; // from new->old.
165  symbols_reverse_map[0] = 0; // map eps to eps.
166  for (Label i = 1; i < static_cast<Label>(symbols.size()); i++) {
167  Label new_i;
168  do {
169  new_i = kaldi::Rand() % (symbols.size() + 20);
170  } while (symbols_reverse_map.count(new_i) == 1);
171  symbols_reverse_map[new_i] = i;
172  }
173  vector<vector<Label> > symbols_new;
174  vector<Label> symbol_map(symbols.size()); // from old->new.
175  typename std::map<Label, Label>::iterator iter = symbols_reverse_map.begin();
176  for (; iter != symbols_reverse_map.end(); iter++) {
177  Label new_label = iter->first, old_label = iter->second;
178  if (new_label >= static_cast<Label>(symbols_new.size())) symbols_new.resize(new_label+1);
179  symbols_new[new_label] = symbols[old_label];
180  symbol_map[old_label] = new_label;
181  }
182  MapInputSymbols(symbol_map, &fst_factored_copy);
183  ExpandInputSequences(symbols_new, &fst_factored_copy);
184  assert(RandEquivalent(fst, fst_factored_copy,
185  5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/,
186  100/*path length-- max?*/));
187  }
188 
189 }

235  bool foll = (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0);
236  bool is_symbol = (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0);
237 
238 
239  VectorFst<Arc> fst2(*fst);
240 
241  if (foll) {
242  MakeFollowingInputSymbolsSame(is_symbol, &fst2);
243  assert(FollowingInputSymbolsAreSame(is_symbol, fst2));
244  } else {
245  MakePrecedingInputSymbolsSame(is_symbol, &fst2);
246  assert(PrecedingInputSymbolsAreSame(is_symbol, fst2));
247  }
248

277 
278  TestFunctor<Arc> f;
279  if (foll) {
280  MakeFollowingInputSymbolsSameClass(is_symbol, &fst2, f);
281  assert(FollowingInputSymbolsAreSameClass(is_symbol, fst2, f));
282  } else {

284  assert(PrecedingInputSymbolsAreSameClass(is_symbol, fst2, f));

void fst::TestMinimize ( )

Definition at line 328 of file determinize-star-test.cc.

References DeleteISymbols(), DeterminizeStar(), rnnlm::i, rnnlm::j, PreDeterminize(), and kaldi::Rand().

328  {
329  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
330  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
331  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
332 
333  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = new VectorFst<Arc>();
334  int n_syms = 2 + kaldi::Rand() % 5, n_states = 3 + kaldi::Rand() % 10, n_arcs = 5 + kaldi::Rand() % 30, n_final = 1 + kaldi::Rand()%3; // Up to 2 unique symbols.
335  cout << "Testing pre-determinize with "<<n_syms<<" symbols, "<<n_states<<" states and "<<n_arcs<<" arcs and "<<n_final<<" final states.\n";
336  SymbolTable *sptr =NULL;
337 
338  vector<Label> all_syms; // including epsilon.
339  // Put symbols in the symbol table from 1..n_syms-1.
340  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_syms;i++)
341  all_syms.push_back(i);
342 
343  // Create states.
344  vector<StateId> all_states;
345  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_states;i++) {
346  StateId this_state = fst->AddState();
347  if (i == 0) fst->SetStart(i);
348  all_states.push_back(this_state);
349  }
350  // Set final states.
351  for (size_t j = 0;j < (size_t)n_final;j++) {
352  StateId id = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
353  Weight weight = (Weight)(0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 5) );
354  printf("calling SetFinal with %d and %f\n", id, weight.Value());
355  fst->SetFinal(id, weight);
356  }
357  // Create arcs.
358  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_arcs;i++) {
359  Arc a;
360  a.nextstate = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
361  a.ilabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms];
362  a.olabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms]; // same input+output vocab.
363  a.weight = (Weight) (0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 2));
364  StateId start_state = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
365  fst->AddArc(start_state, a);
366  }
367 
368  std::cout <<" printing before trimming\n";
369  {
370 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
371  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
372 #else
373  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
374 #endif
375  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
376  }
377  // Trim resulting FST.
378  Connect(fst);
379 
380  std::cout <<" printing after trimming\n";
381  {
382 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
383  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
384 #else
385  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
386 #endif
387  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
388  }
389 
390  VectorFst<Arc> *fst_copy_orig = new VectorFst<Arc>(*fst);
391 
392  vector<Label> extra_syms;
393  if (fst->Start() != kNoStateId) { // "Connect" did not make it empty....
394  PreDeterminize(fst, 1000, &extra_syms);
395  }
396 
397  std::cout <<" printing after predeterminization\n";
398  {
399 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
400  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
401 #else
402  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
403 #endif
404  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
405  }
406 
407 
408  { // Remove epsilon. All default args.
409  bool connect = true;
410  Weight weight_threshold = Weight::Zero();
411  int64 nstate = -1; // Relates to pruning.
412  double delta = kDelta; // I think a small weight value. Relates to some kind of pruning,
413  // I guess. But with no epsilon cycles, probably doensn't matter.
414  RmEpsilon(fst, connect, weight_threshold, nstate, delta);
415  }
416 
417  std::cout <<" printing after epsilon removal\n";
418  {
419 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
420  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
421 #else
422  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
423 #endif
424  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
425  }
426  VectorFst<Arc> ofst_orig;
427  VectorFst<Arc> ofst_star;
428 
429  {
430  printf("Determinizing with baseline\n");
431  DeterminizeOptions<Arc> opts; // Default options.
432  Determinize(*fst, &ofst_orig, opts);
433  }
434  {
435  std::cout <<" printing after determinization [baseline]\n";
436 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
437  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_orig, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
438 #else
439  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_orig, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
440 #endif
441  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
442  }
443 
444 
445  {
446  printf("Determinizing with DeterminizeStar to Gallic semiring\n");
447  VectorFst<GallicArc<Arc> > gallic_fst;
448 
449  DeterminizeStar(*fst, &gallic_fst);
450  {
451  std::cout <<" printing after determinization by DeterminizeStar [in gallic]\n";
452 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
453  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
454 #else
455  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
456 #endif
457  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
458  }
459 
460 
461  printf("Pushing weights\n");
462  Push(&gallic_fst, REWEIGHT_TO_INITIAL, kDelta);
463 
464  {
465  std::cout <<" printing after pushing weights [in gallic]\n";
466 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
467  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
468 #else
469  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
470 #endif
471  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
472  }
473 
474 
475  printf("Minimizing [in Gallic]\n");
476  Minimize(&gallic_fst);
477  {
478  std::cout <<" printing after minimization [in gallic]\n";
479 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
480  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
481 #else
482  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(gallic_fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
483 #endif
484  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
485  }
486 
487  printf("Converting gallic back to regular [my approach]\n");
488 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
489  TrivialFactorWeightFst< GallicArc<Arc, GALLIC_LEFT>, GallicFactor<typename Arc::Label,
490  typename Arc::Weight, GALLIC_LEFT> > fwfst(gallic_fst);
491 #else
492  TrivialFactorWeightFst< GallicArc<Arc, STRING_LEFT>, GallicFactor<typename Arc::Label,
493  typename Arc::Weight, STRING_LEFT> > fwfst(gallic_fst);
494 #endif
495  {
496  std::cout <<" printing factor-weight FST\n";
497 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
498  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(fwfst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
499 #else
500  FstPrinter<GallicArc< Arc> > fstprinter(fwfst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
501 #endif
502  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
503  }
504 
505 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
506  Map(fwfst, &ofst_star, FromGallicMapper<Arc, GALLIC_LEFT>());
507 #else
508  Map(fwfst, &ofst_star, FromGallicMapper<Arc, STRING_LEFT>());
509 #endif
510 
511  {
512  std::cout <<" printing after converting back to regular FST\n";
513 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
514  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
515 #else
516  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
517 #endif
518  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
519  }
520 
521  }
522 
523 
524  assert(RandEquivalent(ofst_orig, ofst_star, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
525 
526 
527  int64 num_removed = DeleteISymbols(&ofst_star, extra_syms);
528  std::cout <<" printing after removing "<<num_removed<<" instances of extra symbols\n";
529  {
530 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
531  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
532 #else
533  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst_star, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
534 #endif
535  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
536  }
537 
538  std::cout <<" Checking equivalent to original FST.\n";
539  // giving Rand() as a seed stops the random number generator from always being reset to
540  // the same point each time, while maintaining determinism of the test.
541  assert(RandEquivalent(ofst_star, *fst_copy_orig, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
542 
543  delete fst;
544  delete fst_copy_orig;
545 }

27  {
28  typedef StdArc Arc;
29  typedef Arc::Label Label;
30  typedef Arc::StateId StateId;

32

38 
39  {
40 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
41  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*ifst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
42 #else
43  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*ifst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
44 #endif
45  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
46  std::cout << endl;
47  }
48 
49  // Do the special pruning.
50  VectorFst<Arc> ofst1;
51  PruneSpecial<StdArc>(*ifst, &ofst1, beam);
52  {
53 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
54  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst1, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
55 #else
56  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst1, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
57 #endif
58  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
59  std::cout << endl;
60  }
61 
62  // Do the normal pruning.
63  VectorFst<Arc> ofst2;
64  Prune(*ifst, &ofst2, beam);
65  {
66 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
67  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst2, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
68 #else
69  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(ofst2, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
70 #endif
71  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
72  std::cout << endl;
73  }
74 
75  KALDI_ASSERT(RandEquivalent(ofst1, ofst2,
76  5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/,
77  100/*path length-- max?*/));
78 
79  delete ifst;
80 }

238  {
239  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
240  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
241  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
242 
243  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = new VectorFst<Arc>();
244  int n_syms = 2 + kaldi::Rand() % 5, n_states = 3 + kaldi::Rand() % 10, n_arcs = 5 + kaldi::Rand() % 30, n_final = 1 + kaldi::Rand()%3; // Up to 2 unique symbols.
245  cout << "Testing pre-determinize with "<<n_syms<<" symbols, "<<n_states<<" states and "<<n_arcs<<" arcs and "<<n_final<<" final states.\n";
246  SymbolTable *sptr = NULL;
247 
248  vector<Label> all_syms; // including epsilon.
249  // Put symbols in the symbol table from 1..n_syms-1.
250  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_syms;i++)
251  all_syms.push_back(i);
252 
253  // Create states.
254  vector<StateId> all_states;
255  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_states;i++) {
256  StateId this_state = fst->AddState();
257  if (i == 0) fst->SetStart(i);
258  all_states.push_back(this_state);
259  }
260  // Set final states.
261  for (size_t j = 0;j < (size_t)n_final;j++) {
262  StateId id = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
263  Weight weight = (Weight)(0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 5) );
264  printf("calling SetFinal with %d and %f\n", id, weight.Value());
265  fst->SetFinal(id, weight);
266  }
267  // Create arcs.
268  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_arcs;i++) {
269  Arc a;
270  a.nextstate = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
271  a.ilabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms];
272  a.olabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms]; // same input+output vocab.
273  a.weight = (Weight) (0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 2));
274  StateId start_state = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
275  fst->AddArc(start_state, a);
276  }
277 
278  std::cout <<" printing before trimming\n";
279  {
280 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
281  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
282 #else
283  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
284 #endif
285  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
286  }
287  // Trim resulting FST.
288  Connect(fst);
289 
290  std::cout <<" printing after trimming\n";
291  {
292 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
293  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
294 #else
295  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
296 #endif
297  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
298  }
299 
300  VectorFst<Arc> *fst_copy_orig = new VectorFst<Arc>(*fst);
301 
302  vector<Label> extra_syms;
303  if (fst->Start() != kNoStateId) { // "Connect" did not make it empty....
304  PreDeterminize(fst, 1000, &extra_syms);
305  }
306 
307  VectorFst<Arc> fst_pushed;
308  std::cout << "Pushing FST\n";
309  Push<Arc, REWEIGHT_TO_INITIAL>(*fst, &fst_pushed, kPushWeights|kPushLabels, kDelta);

317 #endif
318  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
319  }
320

31  {
32  typedef StdArc Arc;
33  typedef Arc::Label Label;
34  typedef Arc::StateId StateId;
35  typedef Arc::Weight Weight;
36 
37  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = RandFst<StdArc>();
38 
39  {
40 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
41  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
42 #else
43  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
44 #endif
45  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
46  }
47 
48  VectorFst<Arc> fst_copy(*fst);
49 
50  float delta = kDelta;
51  PushSpecial(&fst_copy, delta);
52 
53  Weight min, max;
54  float delta_dontcare = 0.1;
55  IsStochasticFstInLog(fst_copy, delta_dontcare, &min, &max);
56  // the per-state normalizers are allowed to deviate from the average by delta
57  // up and down, so the difference from the min to max weight should be 2*delta
58  // or less. We give it a bit of wiggle room (->2.5) due to numerical roundoff.
59 
60 
61  {
62 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
63  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst_copy, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
64 #else
65  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst_copy, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
66 #endif
67  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
68  }
69  KALDI_LOG << "Min value is " << min.Value() << ", max value is " << max.Value();
70 
71  // below, should be <= delta but different pieces of code compute this in this
72  // part vs. push-special, so the roundoff may be different.
73  KALDI_ASSERT(std::abs(min.Value() - max.Value()) <= 1.2 * delta);
74 
75  KALDI_ASSERT(RandEquivalent(*fst, fst_copy,
76  5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
77  delete fst;
78 }
