33  {
34  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
35  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
36  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
37 
38  VectorFst<Arc> fst;
39  int n_syms = 2 + kaldi::Rand() % 5, n_arcs = 5 + kaldi::Rand() % 30, n_final = 1 + kaldi::Rand()%10;
40 
41  SymbolTable symtab("my-symbol-table"), *sptr = &symtab;
42 
43  vector<Label> all_syms; // including epsilon.
44  // Put symbols in the symbol table from 1..n_syms-1.
45  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_syms;i++) {
46  std::stringstream ss;
47  if (i == 0) ss << "<eps>";
48  else ss<<i;
49  Label cur_lab = sptr->AddSymbol(ss.str());
50  assert(cur_lab == (Label)i);
51  all_syms.push_back(cur_lab);
52  }
53  assert(all_syms[0] == 0);
54 
55  fst.AddState();
56  int cur_num_states = 1;
57  for (int i = 0; i < n_arcs; i++) {
58  StateId src_state = kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states;
59  StateId dst_state;
60  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.1) dst_state = kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states;
61  else {
62  dst_state = cur_num_states++; fst.AddState();
63  }
64  Arc arc;
65  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.3) arc.ilabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand()%all_syms.size()];
66  else arc.ilabel = 0;
67  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.3) arc.olabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand()%all_syms.size()];
68  else arc.olabel = 0;
69  arc.weight = (Weight) (0 + 0.1*(kaldi::Rand() % 5));
70  arc.nextstate = dst_state;
71  fst.AddArc(src_state, arc);
72  }
73  for (int i = 0; i < n_final; i++) {
74  fst.SetFinal(kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states, (Weight) (0 + 0.1*(kaldi::Rand() % 5)));
75  }
76 
77  if (kaldi::RandUniform() < 0.8) fst.SetStart(0); // usually leads to nicer examples.
78  else fst.SetStart(kaldi::Rand() % cur_num_states);
79 
80  Connect(&fst);
81  if (fst.Start() == kNoStateId) return; // "Connect" made it empty.
82 
83  std::cout <<" printing after trimming\n";
84  {
85 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
86  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
87 #else
88  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
89 #endif
90  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
91  }

121  {
122  // test that RemoveEpsLocalSpecial preserves equivalence in tropical while
123  // maintaining stochasticity in log.
124  typedef VectorFst<LogArc> Fst;
125  typedef LogArc::Weight Weight;
126  typedef LogArc::StateId StateId;
127  typedef LogArc Arc;
128  VectorFst<LogArc> *logfst = RandFst<LogArc>();
129 
130  { // Make the FST stochastic.
131  for (StateId s = 0; s < logfst->NumStates(); s++) {
132  Weight w = logfst->Final(s);
133  for (ArcIterator<Fst> aiter(*logfst, s); !aiter.Done(); aiter.Next()) {
134  w = Plus(w, aiter.Value().weight);
135  }
136  if (w != Weight::Zero()) {
137  logfst->SetFinal(s, Divide(logfst->Final(s), w, DIVIDE_ANY));
138  for (MutableArcIterator<Fst> aiter(logfst, s); !aiter.Done(); aiter.Next()) {
139  Arc a = aiter.Value();
140  a.weight = Divide(a.weight, w, DIVIDE_ANY);
141  aiter.SetValue(a);
142  }
143  }
144  }
145  }
146 #ifndef _MSC_VER
147  assert(IsStochasticFst(*logfst, kDelta*10));
148 #endif
149  {
150  std::cout << "logfst = \n";
151 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
152  FstPrinter<LogArc> fstprinter(*logfst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
153 #else
154  FstPrinter<LogArc> fstprinter(*logfst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
155 #endif
156  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
157  }
158 
159  VectorFst<StdArc> fst;
160  Cast(*logfst, &fst);
161  VectorFst<StdArc> fst_copy(fst);
162  RemoveEpsLocalSpecial(&fst); // removes eps in std-arc but keep stochastic in log-arc
163  // make sure equivalent.
164  assert(RandEquivalent(fst, fst_copy, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
165  VectorFst<LogArc> logfst2;
166  Cast(fst, &logfst2);
167 
168  {
169  std::cout << "logfst2 = \n";
170 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
171  FstPrinter<LogArc> fstprinter(logfst2, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
172 #else
173  FstPrinter<LogArc> fstprinter(logfst2, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
174 #endif
175  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
176  }
177  if (ApproxEqual(ShortestDistance(*logfst), ShortestDistance(logfst2))) {
178  // make sure we preserved stochasticity in cases where doing so was
179  // possible... if the log-semiring total weight changed, then it is
180  // not possible so don't assert this.
181  assert(IsStochasticFst(logfst2, kDelta*10));
182  }
183  delete logfst;
184 }

97  { // also tests SafeDeterminizeMinimizeWrapper().
98  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
99  typedef typename Arc::StateId StateId;
100  typedef typename Arc::Weight Weight;
101 
102  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = new VectorFst<Arc>();
103  int n_syms = 2 + kaldi::Rand() % 5, n_states = 3 + kaldi::Rand() % 10, n_arcs = 5 + kaldi::Rand() % 30, n_final = 1 + kaldi::Rand()%3; // Up to 2 unique symbols.
104  cout << "Testing pre-determinize with "<<n_syms<<" symbols, "<<n_states<<" states and "<<n_arcs<<" arcs and "<<n_final<<" final states.\n";
105  SymbolTable *sptr = new SymbolTable("my-symbol-table");
106  sptr->AddSymbol("<eps>");
107  delete sptr;
108  sptr = new SymbolTable("my-symbol-table");
109 
110  vector<Label> all_syms; // including epsilon.
111  // Put symbols in the symbol table from 1..n_syms-1.
112  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_syms;i++) {
113  std::stringstream ss;
114  if (i == 0) ss << "<eps>";
115  else ss<<i;
116  Label cur_lab = sptr->AddSymbol(ss.str());
117  assert(cur_lab == (Label)i);
118  all_syms.push_back(cur_lab);
119  }
120  assert(all_syms[0] == 0);
121 
122  // Create states.
123  vector<StateId> all_states;
124  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_states;i++) {
125  StateId this_state = fst->AddState();
126  if (i == 0) fst->SetStart(i);
127  all_states.push_back(this_state);
128  }
129  // Set final states.
130  for (size_t j = 0;j < (size_t)n_final;j++) {
131  StateId id = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
132  Weight weight = (Weight)(0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 5) );
133  printf("calling SetFinal with %d and %f\n", id, weight.Value());
134  fst->SetFinal(id, weight);
135  }
136  // Create arcs.
137  for (size_t i = 0;i < (size_t)n_arcs;i++) {
138  Arc a;
139  a.nextstate = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
140  a.ilabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms];
141  a.olabel = all_syms[kaldi::Rand() % n_syms]; // same input+output vocab.
142  a.weight = (Weight) (0.33*(kaldi::Rand() % 2));
143  StateId start_state = all_states[kaldi::Rand() % n_states];
144  fst->AddArc(start_state, a);
145  }
146 
147  std::cout <<" printing before trimming\n";
148  {
149 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
150  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
151 #else
152  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
153 #endif
154  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
155  }
156  // Trim resulting FST.
157  Connect(fst);
158 
159  std::cout <<" printing after trimming\n";
160  {
161 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
162  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true, "\t");
163 #else
164  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, sptr, sptr, NULL, false, true);
165 #endif
166  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
167  }
168 
169  VectorFst<Arc> *fst_copy_orig = new VectorFst<Arc>(*fst);
170 
171  VectorFst<Arc> *fst_det = new VectorFst<Arc>;
172 
173  vector<Label> extra_syms;
174  if (fst->Start() != kNoStateId) { // "Connect" did not make it empty....
175  if (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0)
176  SafeDeterminizeWrapper(fst_copy_orig, fst_det);
177  else {
178  if (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0)
179  SafeDeterminizeMinimizeWrapper(fst_copy_orig, fst_det);
180  else
181  SafeDeterminizeMinimizeWrapperInLog(fst_copy_orig, fst_det);
182  }
183 
184  // no because does shortest-dist on weights even if not pushing on them.
185  // PushInLog<REWEIGHT_TO_INITIAL>(fst_det, kPushLabels); // will always succeed.
186  KALDI_LOG << "Num states [orig]: " << fst->NumStates() << "[det]" << fst_det->NumStates();
187  assert(RandEquivalent(*fst, *fst_det, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/));
188  }
189  delete fst;
190  delete fst_copy_orig;
191  delete fst_det;
192  delete sptr;
193 }

References DefaultLatticeScale(), rnnlm::i, kaldi::Rand(), and ScaleLattice().

250  {
251  vector<vector<double> > scale1 = DefaultLatticeScale(),
252  scale2 = DefaultLatticeScale();
253  // important that all these numbers exactly representable as floats..
254  // exact floating-point comparisons are used in LatticeWeight, and
255  // this exactness is being tested here.. this test will fail for
256  // other types of number.
257  if (kaldi::Rand() % 4 == 0) {
258  scale1[0][0] = 2.0;
259  scale2[0][0] = 0.5;
260  scale1[1][1] = 4.0;
261  scale2[1][1] = 0.25;
262  } else if (kaldi::Rand() % 3 == 0) {
263  // use that [1 0.25; 0 1] [ 1 -0.25; 0 1] is the unit matrix.
264  scale1[0][1] = 0.25;
265  scale2[0][1] = -0.25;
266  } else if (kaldi::Rand() % 2 == 0) {
267  scale1[1][0] = 0.25;
268  scale2[1][0] = -0.25;
269  }
270 
271 
272  typedef ArcTpl<Weight> Arc;
273  typedef ArcTpl<CompactLatticeWeightTpl<Weight, Int> > CompactArc;
274  for(int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
275  VectorFst<Arc> *fst = RandPairFst<Arc>();
276  /*std::cout << "FST before converting to compact-arc is:\n";
277  {
278  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(*fst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
279  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
280  }*/
281  VectorFst<CompactArc> ofst;
282  ConvertLattice<Weight, Int>(*fst, &ofst, invert);
283  ScaleLattice(scale1, &ofst);
284  /*std::cout << "FST after converting and scaling is:\n";
285  {
286  FstPrinter<CompactArc> fstprinter(ofst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
287  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
288  }*/
289  VectorFst<Arc> origfst;
290  ConvertLattice<Weight, Int>(ofst, &origfst, invert);
291  ScaleLattice(scale2, &origfst);
292  /*std::cout << "FST after back conversion and scaling is:\n";
293  {
294  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(origfst, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
295  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
296  }*/
297  // If RandEquivalent doesn't work, it could be due to a nasty issue related to the use
298  // of exact floating-point comparisons in the Plus function of LatticeWeight.
299  if (!RandEquivalent(*fst, origfst, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 100/*path length-- max?*/)) {
300  std::cerr << "Warn, randequivalent returned false. Checking equivalence another way.\n";
301  assert(Equal(*fst, origfst));
302  }
303  delete fst;
304  }

92  {
93  VectorFst<Arc> nbest_fst_1;
94  ShortestPath(*fst, &nbest_fst_1, 1);
95  VectorFst<Arc> nbest_fst_2;
96  ShortestPath(*fst, &nbest_fst_2, 3);
97  VectorFst<Arc> nbest_fst_1b;
98  ShortestPath(nbest_fst_2, &nbest_fst_1b, 1);
99 
100 
101  assert(ApproxEqual(ShortestDistance(nbest_fst_1),
102  ShortestDistance(nbest_fst_1b)));
103 
104  // since semiring is idempotent, this should succeed too.
105  assert(ApproxEqual(ShortestDistance(*fst),
106  ShortestDistance(nbest_fst_1b)));
107  }
108  {
109  VectorFst<CompactArc> nbest_fst_1;
110  ShortestPath(cfst, &nbest_fst_1, 1);

112  ShortestPath(cfst, &nbest_fst_2, 3);
113  VectorFst<CompactArc> nbest_fst_1b;
114  ShortestPath(nbest_fst_2, &nbest_fst_1b, 1);
115 
116  assert(ApproxEqual(ShortestDistance(nbest_fst_1),
117  ShortestDistance(nbest_fst_1b)));
118  // since semiring is idempotent, this should succeed too.
119  assert(ApproxEqual(ShortestDistance(cfst),
120  ShortestDistance(nbest_fst_1b)));
121  }
122 
123  delete fst;
124  }

kaldi::ApproxEqual
static bool ApproxEqual(float a, float b, float relative_tolerance=0.001)
return abs(a - b) <= relative_tolerance * (abs(a)+abs(b)).

void TestStringRepository ( )

Definition at line 548 of file determinize-star-test.cc.

References rnnlm::i, StringRepository< Label, StringId >::IdOfEmpty(), StringRepository< Label, StringId >::IdOfLabel(), StringRepository< Label, StringId >::IdOfSeq(), rnnlm::j, kaldi::Rand(), StringRepository< Label, StringId >::RemovePrefix(), and StringRepository< Label, StringId >::SeqOfId().

548  {
549  typedef typename Arc::Label Label;
550 
551  StringRepository<Label, inttype> sr;
552 
553  int N = 100;
554  if (sizeof(inttype) == 1) N = 64;
555  vector<vector<Label> > strings(N);
556  vector<inttype> ids(N);
557 
558  for (int i = 0;i < N;i++) {
559  size_t len = kaldi::Rand() % 4;
560  vector<Label> vec;
561  for (size_t j = 0;j < len;j++) vec.push_back( (kaldi::Rand()%10) + 150*(kaldi::Rand()%2)); // make it have reasonable range.
562  if (i < 500 && vec.size() == 0) ids[i] = sr.IdOfEmpty();
563  else if (i < 500 && vec.size() == 1) ids[i] = sr.IdOfLabel(vec[0]);
564  else ids[i] = sr.IdOfSeq(vec);
565 
566  strings[i] = vec;
567  }
568 
569  for (int i = 0;i < N;i++) {
570  vector<Label> tmpv;
571  tmpv.push_back(10); // just put in garbage.
572  sr.SeqOfId(ids[i], &tmpv);
573  assert(tmpv == strings[i]);
574  assert(sr.IdOfSeq(strings[i]) == ids[i]);
575  if (strings[i].size() == 0) assert(ids[i] == sr.IdOfEmpty());
576  if (strings[i].size() == 1) assert(ids[i] == sr.IdOfLabel(strings[i][0]));
577 
578  if (sizeof(inttype) != 1) {
579  size_t prefix_len = kaldi::Rand() % (strings[i].size() + 1);
580  inttype s2 = sr.RemovePrefix(ids[i], prefix_len);
581  vector<Label> vec2;
582  sr.SeqOfId(s2, &vec2);
583  for (size_t j = 0;j < strings[i].size()-prefix_len;j++) {
584  assert(vec2[j] == strings[i][j+prefix_len]);
585  }
586  }
587 
588  }
589 }

43  else opts.table_match_type = MATCH_INPUT;
44  opts.min_table_size = 1 + kaldi::Rand() % 5;
45  opts.table_ratio = 0.25 * (kaldi::Rand() % 5);

81  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
82  }
83

86  Difference(composed, composed_baseline, &diff1);
87  std::cout <<" Diff1 (composed - baseline) \n";
88  {

95  }
96

101  {

106 #endif

212  opts.connect = connect;
213 
214  TableComposeCache<Fst<Arc> > cache(opts);
215 
216  for (size_t i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
217 
218  VectorFst<Arc> *fst1 = RandFst<Arc>();
219 
220 
221  OLabelCompare<Arc> olabel_comp;
222 
223 
224  ArcSort(fst1, olabel_comp);
225 
226  VectorFst<Arc> composed;
227 
228  TableCompose(*fst1, *fst2, &composed, &cache);
229 
230  if (!connect) Connect(&composed);
231 
232  VectorFst<Arc> composed_baseline;
233 
234  Compose(*fst1, *fst2, &composed_baseline);
235 
236 
237  std::cout << "Connect = "<< (connect?"True\n":"False\n");
238 
239 
240  if ( !RandEquivalent(composed, composed_baseline, 5/*paths*/, 0.01/*delta*/, kaldi::Rand()/*seed*/, 20/*path length-- max?*/)) {
241  VectorFst<Arc> diff1;
242  Difference(composed, composed_baseline, &diff1);
243  std::cout <<" Diff1 (composed - baseline) \n";
244  {
245 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
246  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(diff1, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
247 #else
248  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(diff1, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
249 #endif
250  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
251  }
252 
253 
254  VectorFst<Arc> diff2;
255  Difference(composed_baseline, composed, &diff2);
256  std::cout <<" Diff2 (baseline - composed) \n";
257  {
258 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400
259  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(diff2, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true, "\t");
260 #else
261  FstPrinter<Arc> fstprinter(diff2, NULL, NULL, NULL, false, true);
262 #endif
263  fstprinter.Print(&std::cout, "standard output");
264  }
265 
266  assert(0);
267  }
268  delete fst1;
269  }
270 
271  delete fst2;
272 }

612  {
613  WeightType w = Times(w1.Weight(), w2.Weight());
614  if (w == WeightType::Zero()) {
615  return CompactLatticeWeightTpl<WeightType, IntType>::Zero();
616  // special case to ensure zero is unique
617  } else {
618  vector<IntType> v;
619  v.resize(w1.String().size() + w2.String().size());
620  typename vector<IntType>::iterator iter = v.begin();

622  std::copy(w2.String().begin(), w2.String().end(), iter);
623  return CompactLatticeWeightTpl<WeightType, IntType>(w, v);
624  }
625 }

32  {
33  bool ok;
34  if (binary) {
35  // Binary-mode writing.
36  ok = t.Write(os, FstWriteOptions());
37  } else {
38  // Text-mode output. Note: we expect that t.InputSymbols() and
39  // t.OutputSymbols() would always return NULL. The corresponding input
40  // routine would not work if the FST actually had symbols attached. Write a
41  // newline to start the FST; in a table, the first line of the FST will
42  // appear on its own line.
43  os << '\n';
44  bool acceptor = false, write_one = false;
45 #ifdef HAVE_OPENFST_GE_10400

47  NULL, acceptor, write_one, "\t");

50  NULL, acceptor, write_one);
51 #endif
52  printer.Print(&os, "<unknown>");
53  if (os.fail())
54  KALDI_ERR << "Stream failure detected writing FST to stream\n";
55  // Write another newline as a terminating character. The read routine will
56  // detect this [this is a Kaldi mechanism, not something in the original
57  // OpenFst code].
58  os << '\n';
59  ok = os.good();
60  }
61  if (!ok) {
62  KALDI_ERR << "Error writing FST to stream";
63  }
64 }
